column1: A duplicate gauge was used for the period 1932 to 1942 at the same location with much lower readings, the average annual totals nearly 4 inches lower for the new gauge. It is not absolutely clear which gauge continued in use post 1942, however, the station numbers are clear and consistent.
This gauge was replaced by a new gauge in 1959 at a location 530 ft. West of the existing gauge.
The Grid Reference on the 1950s sheet is not clear, however, the new 1959 gauge has a clear grid reference and the Grid Reference above is consistent with the declared distance between them.
